intro: Melampyrum lineare, commonly known as slender touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a hemiparasitic plant, meaning it partially relies on its host plants for water and nutrients. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that are typically clustered in dense spikes. It is often found in open woodlands and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
